semi-structured interviews.reasoning: Semi-structured interviews are a specific qualitative data collection method used to gather in-depth insights from participants, allowing for guided yet flexible conversations that can reveal nuanced understandings of the provider-patient relationship.
passages: Drawing upon semi-structured interviews with complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) providers (N = 17)

provider reflection.reasoning: Provider reflection refers to the method by which CAM providers engage in self-reflection regarding their own bodily experiences to better understand their patients' health experiences, making it a key process in the study's approach to exploring the provider-patient relationship.
passages: The study foregrounds the intersubjective nature of the provider-patient relationship as an embodied interaction in the mutual construction of therapeutic goals.
Provider reflection on their own bodies to make sense of their patients' experiences emphasizes provider-patient coproduction of meaning
